verses.kjv: Behold my servant, whom I uphold; mine elect, in whom my soul delighteth; I have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.
verses.ct: Look at my servant, the one I support — my chosen one, who brings my soul great delight. I have placed my spirit on him; he will bring justice to the nations.

verses.kjv: He shall not cry, nor lift up, nor cause his voice to be heard in the street.
verses.ct: He won't shout or raise his voice or make himself heard in the streets.

verses.kjv: A bruised reed shall he not break, and the smoking flax shall he not quench: he shall bring forth judgment unto truth.
verses.ct: He won't snap a damaged reed, and he won't snuff out a faintly burning wick. He will faithfully bring about true justice.

verses.kjv: He shall not fail nor be discouraged, till he have set judgment in the earth: and the isles shall wait for his law.
verses.ct: He won't grow weak or lose heart until he has established justice on the earth. The distant coastlands will put their hope in his instruction.

verses.kjv: Thus saith God the LORD, he that created the heavens, and stretched them out; he that spread forth the earth, and that which cometh out of it; he that giveth breath unto the people upon it, and spirit to them that walk therein:
verses.ct: This is what God the LORD says — the one who created the heavens and stretched them out, who spread out the earth and everything that grows from it, who gives breath to the people on it and spirit to those who walk on it:

verses.kjv: I the LORD have called thee in righteousness, and will hold thine hand, and will keep thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people, for a light of the Gentiles;
verses.ct: "I, the LORD, have called you in righteousness. I will take hold of your hand and protect you. I will make you a covenant for the people and a light for the nations,

verses.kjv: To open the blind eyes, to bring out the prisoners from the prison, and them that sit in darkness out of the prison house.
verses.ct: to open eyes that are blind, to free captives from prison, and to release from the dungeon those who sit in darkness.

verses.kjv: I am the LORD: that is my name: and my glory will I not give to another, neither my praise to graven images.
verses.ct: I am the LORD — that is my name! I will not share my glory with anyone else, and I will not let carved idols receive the praise that belongs to me.

verses.kjv: Behold, the former things are come to pass, and new things do I declare: before they spring forth I tell you of them.
verses.ct: See, the things I predicted before have now happened, and now I am announcing new things. Before they even begin to unfold, I am telling you about them."

verses.kjv: Sing unto the LORD a new song, and his praise from the end of the earth, ye that go down to the sea, and all that is therein; the isles, and the inhabitants thereof.
verses.ct: Sing a new song to the LORD! Let his praise ring out from the ends of the earth — you who sail the sea and everything in it, you coastlands and everyone who lives there.

verses.kjv: Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up their voice, the villages that Kedar doth inhabit: let the inhabitants of the rock sing, let them shout from the top of the mountains.
verses.ct: Let the desert and its towns raise their voices! Let the villages where Kedar lives join in! Let those who live in Sela sing for joy; let them shout from the mountaintops!

verses.kjv: Let them give glory unto the LORD, and declare his praise in the islands.
verses.ct: Let them give glory to the LORD and proclaim his praise in the coastlands.

verses.kjv: The LORD shall go forth as a mighty man, he shall stir up jealousy like a man of war: he shall cry, yea, roar; he shall prevail against his enemies.
verses.ct: The LORD will march out like a warrior; he will stir up his fighting spirit like a soldier. He will shout — yes, he will roar a battle cry — and he will triumph over his enemies.

verses.kjv: I have long time holden my peace; I have been still, and refrained myself: now will I cry like a travailing woman; I will destroy and devour at once.
verses.ct: "For a long time I have kept silent; I held myself back and said nothing. But now I will cry out like a woman in labor; I will gasp and pant all at once.

verses.kjv: I will make waste mountains and hills, and dry up all their herbs; and I will make the rivers islands, and I will dry up the pools.
verses.ct: I will lay waste to mountains and hills and dry up all their vegetation. I will turn rivers into dry land and drain the pools completely.

verses.kjv: And I will bring the blind by a way that they knew not; I will lead them in paths that they have not known: I will make darkness light before them, and crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them, and not forsake them.
verses.ct: I will lead the blind along roads they have never traveled; I will guide them on paths they have never known. I will turn the darkness ahead of them into light and make the rough places smooth. These are the things I will do for them, and I will not abandon them.

verses.kjv: They shall be turned back, they shall be greatly ashamed, that trust in graven images, that say to the molten images, Ye are our gods.
verses.ct: But those who trust in carved idols, who say to their metal images, 'You are our gods' — they will be driven back in utter disgrace.

verses.kjv: Hear, ye deaf; and look, ye blind, that ye may see.
verses.ct: Listen, you who are deaf! Open your eyes, you who are blind, so that you can see!

verses.kjv: Who is blind, but my servant? or deaf, as my messenger that I sent? who is blind as he that is perfect, and blind as the LORD’s servant?
verses.ct: Who is as blind as my servant? Who is as deaf as the messenger I send? Who is as blind as the one I am committed to, as blind as the servant of the LORD?

verses.kjv: Seeing many things, but thou observest not; opening the ears, but he heareth not.
verses.ct: You have seen so many things, but you pay no attention. Your ears are open, but you don't actually hear.

verses.kjv: The LORD is well pleased for his righteousness’ sake; he will magnify the law, and make it honourable.
verses.ct: It pleased the LORD, for the sake of his righteousness, to make his instruction great and glorious.

verses.kjv: But this is a people robbed and spoiled; they are all of them snared in holes, and they are hid in prison houses: they are for a prey, and none delivereth; for a spoil, and none saith, Restore.
verses.ct: But instead, this is a people who have been robbed and plundered. They are all trapped in pits and hidden away in prisons. They have become prey with no one to rescue them, plunder with no one demanding their return.

verses.kjv: Who among you will give ear to this? who will hearken and hear for the time to come?
verses.ct: Which of you will pay attention to this? Who will listen carefully and take it to heart going forward?

verses.kjv: Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers? did not the LORD, he against whom we have sinned? for they would not walk in his ways, neither were they obedient unto his law.
verses.ct: Who handed Jacob over to be plundered, and Israel to the robbers? Wasn't it the LORD, the one we sinned against? They refused to follow his ways and would not obey his instruction.

verses.kjv: Therefore he hath poured upon him the fury of his anger, and the strength of battle: and it hath set him on fire round about, yet he knew not; and it burned him, yet he laid it not to heart.
verses.ct: So he poured out his burning anger on them, along with the violence of war. It engulfed them like fire on every side, yet they did not understand. It consumed them, yet they did not take it to heart.
